translated: Jātaka
The Dukanipāta
The Nataṁdaḷhavagga
The Khaṇḍa Jātaka
“I have loving-kindness for the Virūpakkhas,
I have loving-kindness for the Erāpathas;
I have loving-kindness for the Chabyāputtas,
I have loving-kindness for the Kaṇhāgotamakas.
I have loving-kindness for the legless,
I have loving-kindness for the two-legged;
I have loving-kindness for the four-legged,
I have loving-kindness for the many-legged.
May the legless not harm me,
may the two-legged not harm me;
May the four-legged not harm me,

original: mā maṁ hiṁsi bahuppado.🔽Sabbe sattā sabbe pāṇā,
analyzed: mā mama hisi bahuppadaḥ  sabbe sattā sabbe pāṇā
translated: may the many-legged not harm me.🔽All beings, all breathing things,
all creatures, all entirely;
May they all see what is auspicious,
may no misfortune come to anyone.
The Buddha is immeasurable,
the Teaching is immeasurable;

analyzed: appamāṇaḥ saṅghaḥ  pamāṇavantāni sarīsapāni  ahi vicchika satapadī
translated: The Sangha is immeasurable,🔽immeasurable are the creeping animals:🔽snakes, scorpions, centipedes,
spiders, lizards, and mice.

original: Katā me rakkhā katā me parittā,
analyzed: katā me rakkhā katā me parittā
translated: I have made my protection, I have made my safeguard,
may the spirits depart.
I pay homage to the Buddha,
I pay homage to the seven fully awakened Buddhas.”
The Khaṇḍa Jātaka is the third.
